instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message:
Working on a stack of 820-3330's tonight and I have stumbled across a weird one. I had to replace the ISL as it had blown Q7030 and Q7035 MOSFETs. It came in with no power but occasionally gets a green light. When the light is on or off the PP3V42 is high (3.415 V), SMC_ACOK is 3.25V, I am investigating around U6990 and noticed that P3V42G3H_BOOST seems high to me as on one side of C6994 I have 6.8V and the other side close to the coil as 3.3V. What else should I check for?
P.S. PPBUS_G3H is 1.2V

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message:
SMC_PM_G2_EN high?
Voltage of PP5V1_CHGR_VDD and PP5V1_CHGR_VDDP?
Resistance to ground on PPBUS_G3H in Ohms?
F7040/41 fuses not blown?

P3V42G3H_BOOST being 'too high' is probably just your multimeter getting confused by the switching, if PP3V42 itself is alright then no worries about it.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message:
P3V42G3H_BOOST MUST be higher.
It is usually aprox 5V higher than the output; check how a buck controller works...
However, it is not a DC voltage only there; as it uses the coil pulses.

=PP3V42_G3H_REG is completely independent of PPBUS_G3H, on AC mode.

Check for corrosion around U6990.
Don't forget R6991/92/95/96.

Assure =PP18V5_DCIN_CONN is stable; if not, means charger detects some leakage on the input of the board..

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message:
SMC_PM_G2_EN is high, 3.38v.
PP5V1_CHGR_VDD is 5.469
PP5V1_CHGR_VDDP is 5.474
Resistance to ground on PPBUS_G3H is -1.025 fluctuating Mega Ohms. May not be doing this right. Not sure why it would show negative unless I had the probes backwards.
The fuses F7040/41 appear fine.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: You are seeing a negative value because either you have power applied or there is residual charge on the rail. Is PPBUS even present and is it 12.56V? Check resistance between pin 17/18 and 27/28 of U7000? DCIN present on U7000?

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: PPBUS_G3H isn't at 12.6v, only 1.3v. Charger was unplugged.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message:
Pins 17/18: 3 Ohms
Pins 27/28: 20 Ohms

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: Oh and yes, 16.8v on PPCHGR_DCIN

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: If there is no short on PPBUS then I would say you killed the 6259 or bad soldering. Also I asked DCIN on U7000, not the DCIN charger rail.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: I'm very sorry, I don't mean to be stupid but from the schematic it sounds like the PPCHGR_DCIN is the DCIN for U7000, but if not I'd definitely like to be corrected. I've replaced the U7000 twice, I'm concerned I may have a bad batch, Thanks a bunch for the help.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: PPCHGR_DCIN yeah sorry that is correct. Does this board power on from a charged battery?

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: No trouble, can't thank you guys enough. I'm out of the office at the moment but will be in around 5:00 PM EST. I'll give that a look and let you know.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: Sorry for the delay, under the weather. The board doesn't power on with the battery plugged in, but with just the power from the battery, I do get 11.8v on pin 24 of U7000. On just the DC jack, I get 2v.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: Then the issue is not with U7000 as the system would power on without it. Still want to know resistance to GND on PPBUS.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: Resistance to GND from PPBUS_G3H is 0.439v.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: My apologies, 2.08 Mega Ohms.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: Apologies, 1.81 Mega Ohms.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: If you gave a green light does the battery indicator work? I'm suspecting an SMC problem.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: Found a bad diode, very hard to see that it was cracked--D6990. Replaced the diode and now getting a green intermittent light on the charger. Checked PPBUS_G3H, I now have a steady 12.28v. With the battery and charger plugged in, I get a steady green light, not orange. Jumped the power on pads to be sure the system won't turn on, no fan spin.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: PPBUS voltage without battery? If 12.23 and the battery indicator also not working I will still say bad SMC.

threads.title: A1286 820-3330 Intermittent Green Light No Power
threads.message: Thanks a ton, definitely a dead SMC, I SMC_RESET_L is high at 3.3v. Damn, I really hate these. Can't thank you guys enough; really helped me out.
